citations.narrative:
On February 25, 2024, 1 ring-necked dove escaped its outdoor primary enclosure through the coop door while a
caretaker was cleaning. During the cleaning of an outdoor enclosure containing 7 chickens and 2 ring-necked doves, the
coop door was opened to bring in supplies. One ring-necked dove escaped through the door. At the time of inspection,
the bird had not been recovered.
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so they are structurally sound, are kept in
good repair, and maintained so they will contain the birds. The facility plans to add a double entry to the enclosure for
increased safety. The remaining dove has been temporarily housed indoors.
This is a 2nd Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection or by April 12, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(iii)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures. 
On February 25, 2024, 1 ring-necked dove escaped its outdoor primary enclosure through the coop door while a 
caretaker was cleaning. During the cleaning of an outdoor enclosure containing 7 chickens and 2 ring-necked doves, the 
coop door was opened to bring in supplies. One ring-necked dove escaped through the door. At the time of inspection, 
the bird had not been recovered. 
 
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so they are structurally sound, are kept in 
good repair, and maintained so they will contain the birds. The facility plans to add a double entry to the enclosure for 
increased safety. The remaining dove has been temporarily housed indoors. 
 
This is a 2nd Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection or by April 12, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n

species.common: BARBARY DOVE / RINGED TURTLE-DOVE / RINGNECK DOVE
